LABOUR SITUATION IN THE COTTON industry memorandum by the Minister of Labour.Without going Into the pest history of events In the cotton Industry, the Cabinet should be Informed that the Federstlon of Master Cotton Spinners and the Cotton Spinners' and Manufacturers' Association have given notice of a wages reduction of 25 per cent on piece prices, l.e. a reduction of the present 95 per cent addition to piece prices to 70 per cent, which is equivalent to a reduction of 12.82 per cent on gross \wages. Tho spinners have indies tod that the reductibn will come into effect on August 3rd, but the manufacturers have only given one month's notice of the termination, v.'Ith a view to application for a reduction being made oMeetings between the parties are in prospect, in accordance with ordinary constitutional practice, and the stage of possible intervention by the Ministry af Labour, whether by conciliation or otherwise, has not been reached.The situation during the coming weeks will undoubtedly be affected by the contemplated enquiry into the Industry, with which the president of the Board of Trade is dealing. (Cabinet 22(29) Conclusion 2).Ministry of Labour, 25th June, 1929.(Intld.) M.B.
